In the year leading up to November 13 Paris attacks, a series of missed opportunities
subhead: A year passed between the Islamic State's decision to carry out a mass killing in France and the attacks of November 13, 2015. Twelve months during which intelligence services missed many opportunities to put a stop to this terrorist cell.

Dozens protest at 'anti-Semitic' event in Austria's parliament
subhead: An event in Vienna hosted by Austria's first far-right parliamentary speaker on Tuesday was denounced by critics as anti-Semitic, with around 200 protestors gathered in front of the parliament building, according to an AFP journalist.

title: Trump claims 'very big victory' as shutdown vote nears
subhead: 'We're opening up our country – it should have never been closed,' said Trump during a Veterans Day speech at Arlington National Cemetery in Virginia. The House of Representatives is set to vote on Wednesday on a spending bill to solve the six-week standoff.

title: The private missions of climate expert François Gemenne at COP30
subhead: Gemenne, a high-profile political scientist, has contributed to the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) but has also faced criticism over his advisory roles with major corporations.

title: In France's Somme, bagpipers keep the memory of the Great War alive
subhead: On the site of the bloodiest battle of World War I, residents of Ovillers-la-Boisselle uphold the tradition of the bagpipers from Scottish, Irish, Canadian and Australian regiments who lost many of their own here in 1916.

Nicolas Sarkozy leaves jail under strict judicial supervision
subhead: The former president cannot leave France and is prohibited from contacting any of the 17 individuals associated with the investigation. The court also barred him from meeting with any senior official with access to confidential information.

title: Hors-Studio: The French duo transforming waste into design
subhead: In Rebecca Fezard and Elodie Michaud's workshop near Tours, these two researchers and sustainability enthusiasts transform leather scraps and oyster shells into biomaterials, which they use to make chairs that look like fossils and tables that seem to emerge from a block of stone.

title: France faces younger, less experienced and more unpredictable jihadist threat
subhead: Nearly 70% of terrorism-related arrests now involve people under 21, and two-thirds of attackers since 2020 were previously unknown to authorities. Since October 7, 2023, over half of all attacks or foiled plots have been linked to the war in Gaza.
